conclusion: Need to analyze the velocity-time graphs for both objects to determine acceleration behavior.
Graph A shows a curve that starts at a lower velocity and increases to a peak velocity, then decreases back to a lower velocity.
Graph B shows a curve that starts at a lower velocity and increases to a peak velocity, then decreases back to a lower velocity.
The time interval from 0 to t1 is the same for both graphs.
For Graph A, the velocity increases from 0 to a peak velocity and then decreases back to 0.
For Graph B, the velocity increases from 0 to a peak velocity and then decreases back to 0.
Acceleration is the change in velocity over time.
For Graph A, the velocity increases from 0 to a peak velocity, so the acceleration is positive.
For Graph A, the velocity decreases back to 0, so the acceleration is negative.
For Graph B, the velocity increases from 0 to a peak velocity, so the acceleration is positive.
For Graph B, the velocity decreases back to 0, so the acceleration is negative.
The accelerations of both objects A and B are first increasing and then decreasing during the time interval from 0 to t1.
